reviewText:
Bought this just to review it to counter some of the negative reviews. Owned it in the CDROM days. Yes there are some compatability issues, but the game ran fine for me, only required a logoff/on to unfreeze desktop after playing. This review is for the game underneath those problems.

It is Worms 3D, before Team17 figured out how to do it in 3D. Except with pigs and Rik Mayall doing a variety of regional and universally racist accents.

10/10 Would go to war just to hear Rik call me a Grand Fromage again.

reviewText: This is one of my favorite childhood games!! I used to play it on PlayStation 1 and I loved it! It was also possible to play pvp, which was the REAL enjoyment! I knew the entire game by heart, but I never managed to complete it perfectly! NOW is my chanse to do exactly that!\n\nI fully recommend this game to everyone! 10/10

reviewText:
IN-DEPTH REVIEW!

If I have time, I will also write guides on how to beat the game and some extra tips and tricks to help you along the way.

The game must be exited via the in-game menu. Do not Alt+Tab or Alt+F4 as this will cause your computer to crash.

WARNING: This game does contain stereotypes which may be considered racist. If you are angered by this then I recommend not buying this game because there is a fair bit of it. (To me, they are pretty tame but I'd prefer just to warn you guys. Like, even the British and Americans have the mickey take out of them so...)

However, if you don't mind, you're in for a treat.

---
Hogs of War Review
Written by SMK - 28/07/2015

WELCOME TO BOOT CAMP!" - Major I.P Grimly

Yes
recommended: welcome one and all to this review of my favourite game of all time
voteText: before you leave because you can clearly see this review will be biased
helpfulPercent: it will not be. There are a lot of problems with the game at the moment and many of them are unfixable. All problems that I have encountered in this version will be noted.\n\nSmall history lesson first
votesHelpful:
this game was created by Infogrames who developed the original Alone in the Dark series and also published Robot Arena 2 and Roller Coaster Tycoon 3. This game began to be sold in June of 2000 on the PSX and later the PC. The game didn't sell well due it's bad use of advertising on TV. A second game was in the works but was however cancelled due to the takeover of Infogrames by Atari in the mid-2000s and due to a lack of funding for the game.

Anyway-
The game.

There is a small backstory behind this game which kind of develops throughout the game. The initial story is that some pigs have enlisted into the army
votesTotal: Major I.P Grimy (Narrated by Rik Mayall) informs them about the 'Isle of Swill' which they must get to so that they can control the world. To do this
votesFunny: they must take all of 'Saustralisa' which many other nations own. The story develops in each mission before it starts where a written document awaits you by Major Grimly telling you what to do and how it will affect the war. That's about all the story there is until the end when you get a few cut scenes about one of the pigs. (Which I won't spoil.)\nThe story offers an excellent level of challenge which builds up as you progress. There are a few missions that break this mold however but it feels amazing when you beat them finally.\nIn the campaign
commentsCount: you control a squad of pigs which you can upgrade as you complete missions. You get one upgrade point for beating a level with a pig dying but you can get two for beating the level without losing any pigs. You can also get more medals later on by doing specific tasks asked by Grimly and that's why it's important to read the mission details before each mission.\n\nA quick section on graphics too... The graphics aren't any good by today's standards as you might expect. However
column16: I believe they've held up rather well and the game is definitely something which shouldn't be shunned at because of it's graphics. Especially in comparison with the PSX version.\n\nThe game plays in a very similar style to Worms. It's turned based combat in 3D using weapons to kill off enemy pigs from different nations in a WWI setting. The pigs are based off real life nations during World War 1
column19: Garlic Grunts represent the French and the Sushi Swines represent Japan. You have a turn timer in which to perform your pigs actions. Your pigs have classes and depending on the class you're controlling depends on what weapons the pig will have. I.E
column20: Engineers have TNT and Mines while Paratroopers have Jetpacks and Machine Guns. The pig's health also depends on which class they are. During the time that you're given
column22: get in a tank or a shelter
column23: find some weapons but as you might imagine
column24: the main objective of your turn is to damage or kill a pig which can be done in an amazing amount of creative ways from as simple as smacking them with your Trotter to throwing some Madness Gas their way to make them go insane and start hopping around.\n\nThe gameplay is solid turn based combat
column25: nothing wrong at all. Extremely satisfying to kill pigs from afar using the Mortar or Airburst. Close combat is still fun as long range
column26: especially as it becomes much more tactical. This is enhanced if you play hotseat multiplayer also.\n\nThe game is narrated all by the British comedy legend Rik Mayall who is unfortunately no longer with us however his fantastic impressions live on through this game. And this is one of the best parts of the game
column27: hearing Mayall's voice is fantastic. He does brilliant impressions of all nations within the game which will make you laugh every time you hear them. Despite them being stereotypical
column28: they shouldn't be taken the wrong way as everyone gets the same treatment
column29: even the British.\n(As a side note
column30: Mayall also played 'Lord Flashheart' in 'Blackadder Goes Forth' which is a World War 1 based comedy mini-series featuring other British comedians such as Rowan Atkinson which he is also God-like in and I highly
column31: highly recommend it.)\n\nDespite all this however
column32: especially in the PC version of the game.\n\nFirst of all
column33: the AI pigs do not move. This was a bug in the original version of the game and wasn't fixed by Infogrames and therefore cannot be fixed now.\nThe music is way too loud and cannot be lowered in-game. The kick in the teeth is that you can't lower it by tabbing out either because it will lock your PC up. This isn't a big problem if you lower your sound before you start the game however.\nThe music constantly plays when it's not suppose to. For instance
column34: when you drop in to a game
column35: you are suppose to hear one small song to start the mission but for some reason
column36: the game plays the extended version of the song and then plays another one on top of it. This also happens when the enemy team is taking its go where it will play 2 songs instead of just one
column37: this can become annoying because it will sometimes overlap into your turn too.\nThe game has a number of graphical glitches if you use the Steam GUI. For instance
column38:
you'll get a skeleton pig when the pig runs away and towards you when it switches screens or the text will freak out and become random lines or text. (As far as I'm aware though this doesn't disrupt gameplay.)
One last thing is that this game can crash. I finished a mission once and it just crashed after the mission so make sure you save your team after every campaign mission.

Just a quick look at some technical stuff too.
Load times are non-existent in this game.
The options are basically useless as changing the resolution will do nothing. The sound options seems to work at times.
Controls are not re-mappable.
There is no controller support.
As you might imagine
column39:
there are no dedicated servers. The only way to create a game is either portfowarding or using hamachi which I haven't tried so I cannot tell if it'll work. (I will try this and update this later.) They will not add dedicated servers in the future either.
Game runs like a dream. Locks at 25 FPS in-game and that's how it's meant to be played so...


To conclude
column40: you can make up your own mind if you want this game. But at a price of £3.99
column43: the game is absolutely worth it at this price and despite all it's glitches
column44: it's still playable and is a ton of fun."

reviewText:
For me this game is pure nostalgia :) i used to play this game on the PS1 together with my father when i was little. Unfortunately the PS1 broke down but now i can finally relive those amazing times :)

gameplay: Its like a 3D worms but this game actually predates the 3d worms game and they did a nice job. The graphics are still the same as those on the PS1 but they are pretty decent for PS1. There is a nice arsanal of weapons spread out across 4 different specialistations which you can give to each of your piggies as you advance in the game. (The super shotgun is by far my favourite weapon in the game)

Pros: Fun gameplay, Humor!, easy to learn but still challenging so it doesn't get boring.
Cons: The music is currently bugged and plays at random times instead of the correct moment. If you do not use the ingame menu to quit windows will freeze. Some minor graphicals glitches.

Overal rating: PS1 version was 9/10 for me but this version is 7.5/10 due to some minor flaws in the game

reviewText:
ONLY FOR WINDOWS 7 AND OLDER

The game is from what I have read here on steam completely unplayable or at least partially playable under windows 10, and in
Windows 8 there are some massive bugs:

Extreme FPS issues in the main menu
Ingame there are some annoying texture issues, in which the map is shown in stripes and becomes transparent.  Screenshot [i.imgur.com]
Otherwise it is running really smoothly ingame, and the fun factor is still there, for me at least. I can look over the fact that the textures ingame are missing, but some people will easily get annoyed at that.

Therefore I only recommend this for Windows 7 and older.

reviewText:
I got this because I loved the game when I had it on PS One (I gave the game away to a girlfriend who had a thing for Rik Mayall and she dumped me soon after) and the chance to play it again was too much to pass up.

The game is every bit as wonderful as I remember it (I've completed the campaign twice now) BUT, and it's only a small but, the music, which you can't turn off or even turn down properly, plays almost at random *and very loudly* drowning out the wonderful Rik Mayall voice acting, which is half the reason for playing the game.

Still, well worth getting and perservering with the poor controls and buggy graphics that it can be prone to, as it's a hell of a lot cheaper on Steam than it is to get on PS One from Ebay!
voteText: 7 of 7 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This has been released way too late on Steam, with little to no compatibility with Windows 8 and Windows 10, and I am willing to bet it's a ball ache to get working properly on Windows 7 as well. Even if you do manage to get it working, I've heard numerous accounts of it breaking basic OS functionality like the alt+F4 shortcut, and task switching, not to mention that if it crashes - you need to reboot the whole system before it'll load up again.

There are also gameplay related issues, like the music being far louder than the dialogue, the latter of which was one of the main selling points of the game. Also the AI in this version is supposedly broken, they won't move tactically, to cover. All in all, it's a mess, and a real shame. Running the game through DOSbox or a virtual machine, or a completely different emulator *cough*ePSXe*cough* /may/ be a solution to some or all of these issues.

Hogs of War on the PS1 was an excellent game, the current publisher realised this and clearly sought to profit from it, but since it is so long since the game was made they were unable to get source code"
date: and thus haven't bothered trying to fix anything at all. Aside from updating the game's description to actually state the compatibility flaws
hoursPlayed: later than they should have.\n\nRIP Rik Mayall
voteText: and thank you for many years of laughter!"

reviewText:
The reasons you shouldn't buy this version:
The game doesn't support modern resolutions.
The sound ballancing is messed up with music much louder than the character voices and SFX, the pigs one-liners (one of the main reasons to play this game).
The controls are mapped wrong with no clear way to remap.
There are bugs and other issues you would expect from an emulated game not something you pay for.
Devs have stated they will not update this product because they lack the source code.

Even if you loved the game on PS1 and are dying for nostalgia this is just going to dissapoint you.

reviewText:
Runs oddly on modern machines, if it runs at all that is. The pigs in menus do not render correctly for me (see pictured: http://puu.sh/ju2Au/bdb149345f.jpg ) though outside of menus there are no graphical issues.

There is poor audio mixing ingame, musical cues on the start of turns occasionally do not play or play the incorrect tunes as each team has their own style. They often drown out charatcer voices and there are only 2 audio sliders, master and sfx.

Menus run at 60fps though the actual gameplay is locked at 25fps.
A classic game all in all though you're much better off finding an original ps1 copy if you wish to enjoy this fully.

!! I recommend the game but not this specific version of it. !!

reviewText: Not only it doesn't work on Windows 8 (or 10 or Mac at that), as clearly stated by the publisher, but after the game fails to run it locks up the OS UI. While I understand that the publisher may not have access to the source code of the game, Mac, W8 and W10 users make up slightly more than half of Steam players. At a 5€ pricetag, there's no way I can give a thumbs up to this version of the game. It certainly is an unpleasant way of tainting one's memory of what is otherwise a fantastically fun classic that you'll be much better off emulating.

reviewText:
To put it simply, this game is my childhood nanny!

I absolutely loved this game on the PS1 when it came out!
This game is very similar to that but with a few alterations that might throw off the player; A.I. not moving, music bugging out every now and then. However I play the PC and PS1 ports regardless and I enjoy comparing the two as I play them.
And I think that if you enjoyed modern turn based tactic games like Worms Clan Wars then I reckon you'll have a great time with this!
I like to play as Team Lard (the purple team),which can be accessed by typing in Mardy Pigs in the rename team option both in single and multiplayer. When I play as this team I like to discover what secrets await when going through the single player campaign.

On a side note, I really enjoy the comedic styles of acting pulled off by the voice actors, Rik Mayall and Marc Silk! Unfortunately Rik is no longer with us but I reckon this would do him proud!

One thing I would like to ask Steam to do in the near future though is if we could get the national regional copies for this game for the people outside of the UK and USA (e.g. Les Cochons De Guerre for France, Frontschweine for Germany and Marranos En Guerra for Spain).

Other than that, thank you Steam for realeasing this little gem. I shall cherish it forever!
